京.definition: capital city of a country; big; algebraic term for a large number (old); artificial mound (old)

京二胡.definition: jing'erhu, a two-stringed fiddle intermediate in size and pitch between the jinghu 京胡 and erhu 二胡, used to accompany Chinese opera; also called 京胡

京口.definition: Jingkou district of Zhenjiang city 鎮江市|镇江市[Zhen4 jiang1 shi4], Jiangsu

京口區.definition: Jingkou district of Zhenjiang city 鎮江市|镇江市[Zhen4 jiang1 shi4], Jiangsu

京斯敦.definition: Kingstown, capital of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines; (Tw) Kingston, capital of Jamaica

京族.definition: Gin or Jing, ethnic minority of China, descendants of ethnic Vietnamese people living mainly in Guangxi; Kinh, the ethnic majority in Vietnam

京杭大運河.definition: the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC

京杭運河.definition: the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC

京滬高鐵.definition: Beijing-Shanghai High-Speed Railway, completed in 2010; abbr. for 京滬高速鐵路|京沪高速铁路

京畿.definition: capital city and its surrounding area

京畿道.definition: Gyeonggi Province, South Korea, surrounding Seoul and Incheon, capital Suweon City 水原市[Shui3 yuan2 shi4]

京胡.definition: jinghu, a smaller, higher-pitched erhu 二胡 (two-stringed fiddle) used to accompany Chinese opera; also called 京二胡

京郊日報.definition: Beijing Suburbs Daily, newspaper in operation 1980-2018

京都念慈菴.definition: King-to Nin Jiom, or just Nin Jiom, manufacturer of 枇杷膏[pi2 pa2 gao1] cough medicine
